ingredients: 3 cups of water, 3-4 lemongrass stalks, bruised and cut into pieces, 4-5 kaffir lime leaves, 4-5 bird's eye chilies, 1 pound of shrimp, peeled and deveined
cooking_method:
1. Bring the water to a boil in a large pot. Add the lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and chilies. Let it simmer for 5 minutes. 
2. Add the shrimp and let it cook for 2-3 minutes until it turns pink. 
3. Remove the pot from the heat and add lime juice and fish sauce to taste.

ingredients: 8 oz. of rice noodles, 1/4 cup of vegetable oil, 1/4 cup of tamarind paste, 1/4 cup of fish sauce, 1/4 cup of sugar, 2 cloves of garlic, minced, 1/4 cup of chopped peanuts, 1/4 cup of chopped cilantro, 1/4 cup of bean sprouts, 1/4 cup of sliced green onions, 1 egg, 8 oz. of chicken breast or shrimp, peeled and deveined
cooking_method:
1. Soak the rice noodles in cold water for 30 minutes. 
2. Heat the oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and stir-fry for 10 seconds. 
3. Add the chicken or shrimp and stir-fry until cooked through. Push the chicken or shrimp to the side of the pan. 
4. Crack the egg into the pan and stir-fry until cooked. 
5. Add the rice noodles, tamarind paste, fish sauce, and sugar. Stir-fry until the noodles are soft and the sauce is absorbed. 
6. Add the peanuts, cilantro, bean sprouts, and green onions. Toss everything together.

ingredients: 2 cups of coconut milk, 1/4 cup of green curry paste, 1 pound of boneless chicken or tofu, cubed, 1/4 cup of fish sauce, 2 tablespoons of sugar, 1 cup of bamboo shoots, 1 cup of Thai eggplant, 1/4 cup of Thai basil leaves, 4-5 kaffir lime leaves
cooking_method:
1. Heat the coconut milk in a large pot over medium heat. 
2. Add the green curry paste and stir until fragrant. 
3. Add the chicken or tofu and stir-fry until cooked. 
4. Add the fish sauce and sugar, and stir until the sugar dissolves. 
5. Add the bamboo shoots, Thai eggplant, and kaffir lime leaves. 
6. Let the curry simmer for 10-15 minutes until the vegetables are tender. 
7. Stir in the Thai basil leaves just before serving.

ingredients: 8 oz. rice noodles, 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil, 2 garlic cloves, minced, 2 eggs, lightly beaten, 8 oz. of shrimp, peeled and deveined, 1 cup of bean sprouts, 1/4 cup of roasted peanuts, chopped, 2 green onions, sliced, 2 tablespoons of fish sauce, 2 tablespoons of tamarind paste, 2 tablespoons of sugar, 1 tablespoon of soy sauce, 1 teaspoon of paprika
cooking_method:
1. Soak the rice noodles in hot water until softened. 
2. Heat the oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. 
3. Add the garlic and stir-fry for a few seconds. 
4. Add the eggs and stir-fry until scrambled. 
5. Add the shrimp and stir-fry until cooked. 
6. Add the noodles, bean sprouts, peanuts, and green onions. 
7. Add the fish sauce, tamarind paste, sugar, soy sauce, and paprika. 
8. Stir-fry until everything is combined and the noodles are heated through.

ingredients: 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil, 1 onion, chopped, 2 garlic cloves, minced, 1 tablespoon of grated ginger, 2 tablespoons of massaman curry paste, 2 cups of coconut milk, 1 pound of beef, cubed, 1 potato, peeled and cubed, 1/4 cup of roasted peanuts, chopped, 2 tablespoons of fish sauce, 2 tablespoons of sugar, 1 tablespoon of tamarind paste, 1 cinnamon stick, 2-3 cardamom pods, 2-3 cloves
cooking_method:
1. Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat. 
2. Add the onion, garlic, and ginger, and stir-fry until fragrant. 
3. Add the massaman curry paste and stir until fragrant. 
4. Add the coconut milk and stir until well combined. 
5. Add the beef and stir-fry until cooked. 
6. Add the potato, peanuts, fish sauce, sugar, tamarind paste, cinnamon stick, cardamom pods, and cloves. 
7. Simmer for 30-40 minutes until the potatoes are tender and the curry has thickened.

ingredients: 3 cups of chicken broth, 2 cups of coconut milk, 1 stalk of lemongrass, bruised and cut into pieces, 4-5 kaffir lime leaves, 2-3 Thai chili peppers, sliced, 1 tablespoon of grated ginger, 1 pound of boneless chicken, sliced, 1/4 cup of fish sauce, 2 tablespoons of lime juice, 2 tablespoons of brown sugar, 1/4 cup of chopped cilantro leaves
cooking_method:
1. In a large pot, bring the chicken broth and coconut milk to a simmer over medium heat. 
2. Add the lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, chili peppers, and ginger, and stir well. 
3. Add the chicken and stir until cooked. 
4. Add the fish sauce, lime juice, and brown sugar, and stir until combined. 
5. Remove from heat and stir in the cilantro leaves. 
6. Serve hot.

ingredients: 8 oz. rice noodles, 1/2 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into small strips, 2 eggs, 1/2 cup bean sprouts, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 3 green onions, sliced, 1/4 cup roasted peanuts, chopped, 1/4 cup vegetable oil, 2 tbsp. fish sauce, 2 tbsp. tamarind paste, 1 tbsp. rice vinegar, 1 tbsp. sugar, 1/2 tsp. cayenne pepper, 1 lime, cut into wedges
cooking_method:
1. Cook noodles according to package directions. Drain and rinse under cold water. Set aside. 
2. In a wok or large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. 
3. Add chicken and cook until browned, about 5 minutes. Remove chicken from wok and set aside. 
4. Add garlic to the wok and cook for 1 minute. 
5. Crack eggs into the wok and scramble until cooked. 
6. Add noodles, chicken, fish sauce, tamarind paste, rice vinegar, sugar, and cayenne pepper to the wok. 
7. Toss until noodles are coated and everything is heated through. 
8. Serve topped with bean sprouts, green onions, chopped peanuts, and a squeeze of lime.

ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into bite-sized pieces, 2 cans of coconut milk, 2 tbsp. green curry paste, 2 tbsp. vegetable oil, 1 green bell pepper, sliced, 1 red bell pepper, sliced, 1/2 cup bamboo shoots, 1/2 cup fresh basil leaves, 2 tbsp. fish sauce, 2 tbsp. brown sugar, 1 tbsp. lime juice, 1/2 tsp. salt
cooking_method:
1. Heat oil in a large pot or wok over medium-high heat. 
2. Add chicken and cook until browned, about 5 minutes. Remove chicken from the pot and set aside. 
3. Add curry paste to the pot and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly. 
4. Add coconut milk, fish sauce, brown sugar, lime juice, and salt to the pot. 
5. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to low. 
6. Add the bell peppers and bamboo shoots to the pot and let simmer for 10 minutes. 
7. Add chicken back to the pot and let simmer for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through. 
8. Stir in the basil leaves just before serving. 
9. Serve hot with rice.

ingredients: 1 cup glutinous rice, 1 can (13.5 oz) coconut milk, 1/4 tsp salt, 1/4 cup sugar, 1 ripe mango
cooking_method:
1. Rinse the rice several times until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in water for at least 30 minutes.
2. In a saucepan, mix together coconut milk, salt, and sugar. Heat the mixture over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the sugar dissolves.
3. Drain the soaked rice and put it in a pot. Add the coconut milk mixture and stir to combine. Bring the mixture to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pot. Cook for about 15 minutes or until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed.
4. While the rice is cooking, peel and slice the mango.
5. Once the rice is cooked, transfer it to a serving dish and top with the sliced mango.
6. Serve warm or at room temperature.
